intro: Sebaea albens, commonly known as the silverleaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Sebaea albens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
